benchmark_details.name: HonestCyberEval: an AI Cyber Risk Benchmark for Automated Software Exploitation
benchmark_details.overview: HonestCyberEval is a new benchmark for assessing AI modelsâ€™ capabilities and risks in automated software exploitation, focusing on their ability to detect and exploit vulnerabilities in real-world software systems.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the capabilities of state-of-the-art LLMs in automated software exploitation tasks and assess their associated risks.

data.source: Nginx web server GitHub repository augmented with synthetic vulnerabilities.
data.annotation: The vulnerabilities were synthetically introduced into the Nginx project.

methodology.calculation: Success rate is calculated as the percentage of vulnerabilities successfully triggered. Cost per vulnerability is based on model usage fees.
methodology.interpretation: Higher success rates and lower costs indicate better model performance.
methodology.baseline_results: o1-preview achieved a success rate of 92.85%.
methodology.validation: Models were tested using a structured environment to ensure fair comparisons.

targeted_risks.harm: Risk associated with the dual-use capabilities of LLMs in cybersecurity.
